page.title: 08A TYPICAL FARM
page.content: Manor Farm is situated some two kilometres west of East Leake and consists of 250acres. There are 250 cows,mostly Friesians.The farmer milks them twice daily.At the moment,the land in use is growing,68 acres of winter wheat,60 acres of barley and 30 acres of oilseed rape. 50 acres of the land is rented from Lord Belper's son.Previously,Lord Belper owned all the land.He gave it to his son who then ran the farm but later sold most of the land. The old farm house was originally built for the squire of West Leake. Manor Farm is a family business and the farmer will pass it on to his son when he retires. Apart from obvious problems with the weather,the farmer reports that his only worries are pneumonia in cows.
